relation: A ram-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters at the Iron Works in Mongolia. Aries is accompanied by Bomb Man and Flame Man.
A water-bearer Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters on the African Coast.
A crab-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters on the floating islands in the Indian Ocean. Cancer is accompanied by Elec Man and Spark Man.
A goat-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters in Africa.

A Constellation Droid that's one half female, one half male. His weapon is inspired by Gemini Man's attack. Mega Man encounters him in a mine in India. Gemini is accompanied by Guts Man and Metal Man.
A lion-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters in an erupting volcano in Borneo. Leo is accompanied by Heat Man and Napalm Man.
A scales-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters in the Great Indian Desert. Libra is accompanied by Cut Man and Hard Man.
A Robot Master with a dolphin for a bottom. Mega Man encounters Pisces on the coasts of the Caspian Sea.
A winged centaur-like Constellation Droid. His design is based on Centaur Man. Mega Man encounters Sagittarius in northern Africa. His weapon is Blazing Arrow.
A scorpion-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters on a Flying Fortress over the Pacific Ocean. Scorpio is accompanied by Cloud Man and Yamato Man.
A bull-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters on the Chinese Coast. Taurus is accompanied by Frost Man and Ice Man.
A virgin-like Constellation Droid who Mega Man encounters on a sunken highway in the Pacific Ocean. Virgo is accompanied by Bubble Man and Freeze Man.
Leader of the Constellation Droids along with Luna.
Leader of the Constellation Droids along with Apollo.
pageTitle: Robot Master - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {102526=SRN is the series code for the "Space Rulers" that appeared in Mega Man V. The Space Rulers were called "Stardroids" in the English releases. Each SRN robot is named after one of the nine planets in the solar system at the time of Mega Man V's release. (Pluto was redesignated as a dwarf planet in 2006.) None of the SRN Robot Masters have Net Navi counterparts.}
textBeforeTable: 000-008 (Mega Man)[edit] DLN series[edit] DLN is the series code for Light Labs, literally standing for "Dr. Light Number". In Japan, their code is DRN, for "Dr. Right Number", though some early Mega Man titles erroneously use the DRN code. List of Robot Masters[edit] 3 See also 2 References 1.6.2 EWN Series 1.6.1 LMN Series 1.6 Other media 1.5.3 Planned Robot Masters 1.5.2 Rockman Strategy 1.5.1 Dimensions series 1.5 Special series 1.4.6 Mega Man 3 (PC) 1.4.5 Mega Man (PC) 1.4.4 MWN series 1.4.3 SRN series 1.4.2 RKN series 1.4.1 KGN series 1.4 Other series 1.3.1 025-032 (Mega Man 4) 1.3 DCN series
textAfterTable: Series Number Short Description Weapon DLN-00A Time Man (タイムマン) Time Man is Dr. Light's pioneering experiment in the creation of time travelling. He can slow the passage of time for brief intervals. He is also very concerned about wasting time, telling people that they are early or late for their battle. Time Man is purple in color, with an alarm-clock like head. Time Slow (タイムスロー) DLN-00B Oil Man (オイルマン) Oil Man is a new type of high performance robot designed for maintenance. Oil for robots can be made inside his body and output through his arm cannon. He uses this oil to attack and can ride an oil slick much like a snowboard. In the Japanese version and the demo given in Mega Man: Maverick Hunter X, Oilman looks like a blackface character. He has been changed in other versions to be dark blue with yellow lips instead of the possibly offensive black with pink lips. In the Mega Man comic series by Archie Comics, his design is modified further, and his red scarf now covers his lips entirely.
